page.title: 01Manderston area,Berwickshire
page.content: One of the most tranquil parts of the Scottish Borderland, lying in "The Merse", a sheltered fertile valley stretching inland from the eastern coast roughly parallel to the course of the River Tweed. Magnificent views look north to the Lammermuir Hills, eastwards as far as the coastline at Berwick-upon-Tweed, 15 miles away & south to the Cheviot Hills in Northumberland. As in the rest of this county, there are no traffic lights, no pedestrian crossings & traffic is minimal. Housing is almost entirely composed of farmhouses & their adjacent cottages. Occupations are mainly agricultural, with supporting services. Some workers commute to Berwick, Eyemouth & Galashiels.
